name: Miami Beach Resort and Spa

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel with a coworker while we were in Miami for a conference. The lobby is nice, and the restaurant was good. However, the room was highly disappointing, and the service was terrible.
reviews.title: Not worth the money

reviews.text: The cost was about $280 a night plus $22 per day for parking. Our room had two double sized beds with hard brick pillows and a stained thin bed sheet. The size of the room was half that of a Holiday Inn, and the stains on the drapes were offensive. Being on the 14th floor we expected good services. However, when we arrived to find a leaking toilet that would not flush, we found that the maintenance would not come and correct the situation. After calling numerous times, the following day a couple of men looked at the toilet, but did not fix it. We were later told by the manager that they needed a new bulb. They should have gotten a new bulb and fixed the toilet instead of leaving two girls in the room with out the use of the restroom.
reviews.title: Not so great

likes.liked: — Not very far from a boardwalk that you could run along the ocean on

reviews.text: The door handle also fell off at one point. It was poorly fixed after numerous complaints again.
reviews.title: Not impressed, won't stay here again
loved miami beach resort and spa
reviews.text: The paint was peeling off the walls, not only in the room, but in the hallway. I have seen cheap Vegas hotels that are more presentable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also had a problem with the mini-bar. We did not need it in the room, but there was a $20 charge to take it out. We decided to leave it in the room, but we never even unlocked the door.
reviews.title: Great stay
Great Hotel Not Luxury Though
reviews.text: Well I booked this hotel as a final stop on our honeymoon.. I have just checked out and am writing this as i wait for my taxi...
We spent four days here after touring brazil & argentina. We stayed at 5* hotels all the way.
reviews.title: Poor Poor Miami Beach Resort and Spa!

likes.liked: — Concierge, good service, pool, beach access, food

reviews.text: I didnt book a 5* in miami as i knew we would be out most of the time and didnt want to waste cash for no reason.
reviews.title: Luxury Price/ Moderate Accomadations

reviews.text: When i booked in jan08 most of the reviews were positive on this site. When i logged on from brazil the night before arrival, i was shaking in my boots... was very nervous at what we might find... This is our honeymoon after all!
reviews.title: deluxe in 1965

likes.disliked: — tired, dated accomodations, poorly trained staff

reviews.text: So when we arived at 4am, no one was around, the place was a ghost town.. but what did i expect... Finally got checked in..
reviews.title: Half good-Half bad

likes.disliked: — Paying for parking, exspensive food, dirty shower.

reviews.text: Reading the mixed reviews about this hotel - I was somewhat apprehensive prior to my arrival. So here's a sampling of what was good and bad about this hotel. It's a decent hotel, certainly wouldn't call it luxury (maybe in 1985?) - but we made the best of it and enjoyed our stay. Next time in Miami, I'll probably give another hotel a shot though.
reviews.title: Decent Stay, But Not Overwhelmed

likes.liked: — Pool area, access to beach, size of room, location
likes.disliked: — rooms outdated, parking fees, housekeeping was poor

reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: NO LUXURY-If anything a Motel 8

reviews.text: Most of the staff was extremely friendly. Jose at check in was very nice, as was the bellman who assisted my family with our bags on arrival and departure. We requested a refrigerator in my room and they waived the fee when they saw we had a baby and were using it primarily to store bottles. I thought that was a nice gesture, given the fee is $15/day. Valet staff was nice, as was the pool staff. Everyone said hello and smiled at guests. I was always addressed by name. Pool staff inflated my children's water toys and they were extremely nice to them.
reviews.title: Alright not worth the money

reviews.text: The pool area was large and plenty of chairs with cushions. The toddler pool was nice for the little ones. I wish they'd keep the pre-teens (acting like animals) out of it, but for the little ones its a nice addition.
reviews.title: All-time worst

reviews.text: If you're looking for peace & quiet, the location was nice. Short drive to South Beach, but you are far enough from the action at night to enjoy the tranquility of the northern end of Miami Beach. Also not too far from MIA or FLL airports or family attractions (Junge Isle, Seaquarium, Monkey Jungle all within 30 mins).
reviews.title: Just okay

likes.liked: — Staff were actually very nice and professional
likes.disliked: — Property and Prices did not match staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took a romantic getaway to Miami Beach and were lucky to find the Miami Beach Resort and Spa. The hotel is beautiful particularly the lobby and pool.
reviews.title: Beautiful Pool and Great Food!

reviews.text: The rooms were very clean and nice and the service was vey consistent and pleasant.
reviews.title: Great Staff, Great Food

likes.disliked: — No coffee shop after noon (12) I think.

reviews.title: Avoid this dump
reviews.text: The pool was amazing and we loved the upper sun lounge deck where you had a great view of the beach and ocean.
Daily we took nice walks on the beach which was easily accessible through the pool area.
reviews.title: Grat Location ... Grat Food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located within walking distance of the shops and bars from the via the beach boardwalk.
reviews.title: The best choice if you stay at Miami Beach

description: Modern high rise oceanfront resort on a private beach, 12 miles from airport. Minutes from South Beach, on trendy Collins Avenue.
